alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Montezuma County through 630 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mancos, or 25 miles west of Durango, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential lightning, and pea to half inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mancos around 610 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 49 and 62. Colorado 145 near mile marker 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
